issue.title: [Bug] OHIF plugin for Orhtanc fails to build for Windows

labels.name: Awaiting Reproduction
labels.description: Can we reproduce the reported bug?

issue.body:
### Describe the Bug

Describe Your Question

 1. I am trying to customize OHIF and compiling the OHIF plugin for Orthanc. Its generating a .so file which is for Linux but unable to build a .dll file for Windows.
 2. I am using OHIF Viewer 3.6.0

I am following this to build the OHIF plugin [OHIF plugin — Orthanc Book documentation](https://book.orthanc-server.com/plugins/ohif.html)

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Customize OHIF.
2. Build the Viewers-3.6.0 archive required by the Orthanc plugin.
3. Try to compile for Windows.

### The current behavior

Fails to compile when I try to build on Windows but passes when I build on Linux. 

### The expected behavior

Should compile on Windows and output a dll file.

### OS

Windows 11

### Node version

latest NodeJS

### Browser

latest firefox

issue.title: [Bug] Callback redirect fails when using PUBLIC_URL and OIDC together (incomplete auth standard workflow with keycloak)

labels.name: Awaiting Reproduction
labels.description: Can we reproduce the reported bug?

issue.body:
### Describe the Bug

Hello,

The issue is somehow similar to a recurrent problem reported in old issues: #2263, #1125, #1925, #2695. But I guest is essentially the same problem reported at #2540, #2850 (tested both with master branch and with tag v3.7.0).

When configuring OIDC as [here](https://github.com/OHIF/Viewers/blob/master/platform/app/public/config/docker_openresty-orthanc-keycloak.js#L38) to work with keycloak, and at the same time using a [PUBLIC_URL](https://docs.ohif.org/configuration/configurationfiles/#environment-variables) and editing routerBasename as explained [here](https://docs.ohif.org/deployment/build-for-production#build-for-non-root-path), the authentication process is unable to work properly. It performs the auth request to keycloak and then is redirect to the callback page, but subsequent calls to keycloak token endpoint never happens:

![image](https://github.com/OHIF/Viewers/assets/12082241/e0ec1ff8-53f9-4b61-933b-de92d67cbf26)

Debugging a bit, I found that the problem occurs [here](https://github.com/OHIF/Viewers/blob/master/platform/app/src/utils/OpenIdConnectRoutes.tsx#L156), due to when routerBasename is modified pathname and redirect_uri do not match and the intended use case for that if does not work:
![image](https://github.com/OHIF/Viewers/assets/12082241/83b9d8f3-64e0-4f62-85d1-f4f145b8cc27). 

It happens only when routerBasename is different than '/'. In case of routerBasename = '/' (regardless PUBLIC_URL value if we are in dev mode with yarn start), it works as expected:

 
![image](https://github.com/OHIF/Viewers/assets/12082241/7463af33-bed0-4fac-9074-ea0d725bf8c9)

And the token request to keycloak occurs finalizing the entire authentication standard flow:

![image](https://github.com/OHIF/Viewers/assets/12082241/c4bd94aa-10d1-48aa-bbfe-bd892daa58e7)

And allowing finally load the study list interface, instead of being stuck at /callback.

I verified that with a minor fix [here](https://github.com/OHIF/Viewers/blob/master/platform/app/src/utils/OpenIdConnectRoutes.tsx#L150-L152):

![image](https://github.com/OHIF/Viewers/assets/12082241/ab0af62e-7fc9-4d82-9fa0-d94eb9378385)


 The problem is solved, and now [the mentioned if case](https://github.com/OHIF/Viewers/blob/master/platform/app/src/utils/OpenIdConnectRoutes.tsx#L156) works as expected for both routerBasename '/':

![image](https://github.com/OHIF/Viewers/assets/12082241/ca91057d-10ce-4842-8f60-c1a7a29fc056)

And routerBasename '/viewer':

![image](https://github.com/OHIF/Viewers/assets/12082241/19ae6a42-53ca-41d6-9c79-8765d7e05309)


This fix is for me an acceptable solution for those cases when authentication OIDC standard flow and context path is required. If it is ok for the community, I can open a PR with this minor change.

Thanks and regards!



### Steps to Reproduce

1. Deploy keycloak and configure a client id for OHIF (I used the quarkus keycloak image from dcm4chee arc project)
2. Configure default.js with the OIDC settings as explained in the description to work with keycloak
3. Edit the routerBasename to provide a context path different than '/' (for instance, '/viewer')
4. Try to access the OHIF interface, it fails both in dev mode (yarn start) and in prod mode (built with PUBLIC_URL env var)

### The current behavior

The authentication standard flow does not finished due to the request to /token endpoint never happens, as it never meets [this condition](https://github.com/OHIF/Viewers/blob/master/platform/app/src/utils/OpenIdConnectRoutes.tsx#L156)

### The expected behavior

once the /auth endpoint of keycload redirects to the /callback endpoint, it is expected that [this condition](https://github.com/OHIF/Viewers/blob/master/platform/app/src/utils/OpenIdConnectRoutes.tsx#L156) resolves to true and the authentication standard flow continues requesting the /token endpoint of keycloak. Finally, once the /token request is done, the application interface must continue to the study list.

### OS

Windows, developing with VS Code directly on WSL. The problem occurs both in dev mode, build mode, and from a docker container also (both official image and built image from the Dokerfile in the Viewers source)

### Node version

18.17.1, 18.18.2 and 20.9.0

### Browser

Chrome 118.0.5993.90

issue.title: [Bug] WADO call instead of QIDO

labels.name: Awaiting Reproduction
labels.description: Can we reproduce the reported bug?

issue.body:
### Describe the Bug

Hello👋 
I'm observing strange behavior on the new OHIF version. 
I'm using the viewer setup by overriding the default configuration. I set the default.js file with **wadoUriRoot** and **wadoRoot** to my wado endpoint, and **qidoRoot** to my qido endpoint.
However, when I load a series in the viewer, I'm facing a strange call:
https://hostname/my_wado_endpoint/studies/2.16.56.465769650.1.49565750525656/series?SeriesInstanceUID=1.3.12.2.1107.5.3.33.1103.2.201005141318130750

Here the call looks like a QIDO call, not a WADO one.
![image](https://github.com/OHIF/Viewers/assets/4542315/d4718681-bce1-4f59-9283-c27749d95169)

It would be constructive to give me feedback on this analysis.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Load a series via a direct URL to the viewer: https://hostname/.../ohif/viewer?StudyInstanceUIDs=2.16.56.465769650.3317998548.3382173681&SeriesInstanceUIDs=1.2.840.113619.2.278.3.655633.665.1340370393.118.3

### The current behavior

The call https://hostname/my_wado_endpoint/studies/2.16.56.465769650.1.49565750525656/series?SeriesInstanceUID=1.3.12.2.1107.5.3.33.1103.2.201005141318130750
is targeting WADO url

### The expected behavior

https://hostname/my_WADO_endpoint/studies/2.16.56.465769650.1.49565750525656/series?SeriesInstanceUID=1.3.12.2.1107.5.3.33.1103.2.201005141318130750
Must be:
https://hostname/my_QIDO_endpoint/studies/2.16.56.465769650.1.49565750525656/series?SeriesInstanceUID=1.3.12.2.1107.5.3.33.1103.2.201005141318130750

This WADO URL must target the QIDO endpoint !

### OS

Windows 10 Professionnel

### Node version

16.19.0

### Browser

Chrome Version 118.0.5993.89 (Build officiel) (64 bits)

comment.body: I like to keep this one open too since it has a lot of useful details, but we will look

issue.title: [Bug] WADO call instead of QIDO

labels.name: Awaiting Reproduction
labels.description: Can we reproduce the reported bug?

issue.body:
### Describe the Bug

Hello👋 
I'm observing strange behavior on the new OHIF version. 
I'm using the viewer setup by overriding the default configuration. I set the default.js file with **wadoUriRoot** and **wadoRoot** to my wado endpoint, and **qidoRoot** to my qido endpoint.
However, when I load a series in the viewer, I'm facing a strange call:
https://hostname/my_wado_endpoint/studies/2.16.56.465769650.1.49565750525656/series?SeriesInstanceUID=1.3.12.2.1107.5.3.33.1103.2.201005141318130750

Here the call looks like a QIDO call, not a WADO one.
![image](https://github.com/OHIF/Viewers/assets/4542315/d4718681-bce1-4f59-9283-c27749d95169)

It would be constructive to give me feedback on this analysis.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Load a series via a direct URL to the viewer: https://hostname/.../ohif/viewer?StudyInstanceUIDs=2.16.56.465769650.3317998548.3382173681&SeriesInstanceUIDs=1.2.840.113619.2.278.3.655633.665.1340370393.118.3

### The current behavior

The call https://hostname/my_wado_endpoint/studies/2.16.56.465769650.1.49565750525656/series?SeriesInstanceUID=1.3.12.2.1107.5.3.33.1103.2.201005141318130750
is targeting WADO url

### The expected behavior

https://hostname/my_WADO_endpoint/studies/2.16.56.465769650.1.49565750525656/series?SeriesInstanceUID=1.3.12.2.1107.5.3.33.1103.2.201005141318130750
Must be:
https://hostname/my_QIDO_endpoint/studies/2.16.56.465769650.1.49565750525656/series?SeriesInstanceUID=1.3.12.2.1107.5.3.33.1103.2.201005141318130750

This WADO URL must target the QIDO endpoint !

### OS

Windows 10 Professionnel

### Node version

16.19.0

### Browser

Chrome Version 118.0.5993.89 (Build officiel) (64 bits)

comment.body:
Yes true, this is exactly the same bug
Remember:
![image](https://github.com/OHIF/Viewers/assets/4542315/6f01fec2-256c-4f53-aa88-acc1bde97cb8)

I let you define the new status of this issue, should probably be closed, or marked as duplicated

issue.title: feat: more i18n support
issue.body:

### Context

This PR adds more i18n support

### Changes & Results

<!--
List all the changes that have been done, such as:
- Add new components
- Remove old components
- Update dependencies

What are the effects of this change?
- Before vs After
- Screenshots / GIFs / Videos
-->
* i18n keys for UserPreferencesModal and AboutModal
* ability to customize date and time format in WorkList
* i18n keys for DateRange buttons
* seriesTableColumns keys moved to WorkList from StudyListExpandedRow
* InputLabelWrapper keys for filters moved to filtersMeta
* 'Studies' in StudyListFilter renamed to 'Number of studies'. 'Number of studies' and numOfStudies variable moved in one tag

### Testing

You can try switching to another language.
To change the date and time format, add localDateFormat and localTimeFormat to Common.json (e.g. "localDateFormat": "DD.MM.YYYY",  "localTimeFormat": "HH:mm"). If the key is not specified, the default value is used.
<!--

- open a URL
- visit a page
- click on a button
- etc.
-->

issue.title: feat: 🎸 Add SeriesInstanceUIDs wado query param
issue.body:
Add a way to retrieve a subset of series from a study

<!-- Do Not Delete This! pr_template -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://github.com/OHIF/Viewers/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md -->
<!-- 🕮 Read our guide about our Contributing Guide here https://docs.ohif.org/development/contributing -->
<!-- :hand: Thank you for starting this amazing contribution! -->

<!--
⚠️⚠️ Please make sure the checklist section below is complete before submitting your PR.
To complete the checklist, add an 'x' to each item: [] -> [x]
(PRs that do not have all the checkboxes marked will not be approved)
-->

### Context

This will only open the viewer with one series (one displaySet) loaded, and no
queries made for any other series.

Sometimes you need to only retrieve a subset of series in a study, you can do
that by providing study level wado query parameters in the URL such as
SeriesInstanceUIDs. For example:

```js
http://localhost:3000/viewer?StudyInstanceUIDs=1.3.6.1.4.1.25403.345050719074.3824.20170125113417.1&SeriesInstanceUIDs=1.3.6.1.4.1.25403.345050719074.3824.20170125113545.4,1.3.6.1.4.1.25403.345050719074.3824.20170125113545.5
```


<!--
Provide a clear explanation of the reasoning behind this change, such as:
- A link to the issue being addressed, using the format "Fixes #ISSUE_NUMBER"
- An image showing the issue or problem being addressed (if not already in the issue)
- Error logs or callStacks to help with the understanding of the problem (if not already in the issue)
-->

### Changes & Results

- Add new query param to filter series
- Update retrieve study metadata services

<!--
List all the changes that have been done, such as:
- Add new components
- Remove old components
- Update dependencies

What are the effects of this change?
- Before vs After
- Screenshots / GIFs / Videos
-->

### Testing

<!--
Describe how we can test your changes.
- open a URL
- visit a page
- click on a button
- etc.
-->

### Checklist

#### PR

<!--
https://semantic-release.gitbook.io/semantic-release/#how-does-it-work

Examples:
Please note the letter casing in the provided examples (upper or lower).

- feat(MeasurementService): add ...
- fix(Toolbar): fix ...
- docs(Readme): update ...
- style(Whitespace): fix ...
- refactor(ExtensionManager): ...
- test(HangingProtocol): Add test ...
- chore(git): update ...
- perf(VolumeLoader): ...

You don't need to have each commit within the Pull Request follow the rule,
but the PR title must comply with it, as it will be used as the commit message
after the commits are squashed.
-->

- [x] My Pull Request title is descriptive, accurate and follows the
  semantic-release format and guidelines.

#### Code

- [x] My code has been well-documented (function documentation, inline comments,
  etc.)

#### Public Documentation Updates

<!-- https://docs.ohif.org/ -->

- [x] The documentation page has been updated as necessary for any public API
  additions or removals.

#### Tested Environment

- [x] OS: macOS 14.0 (23A344)]
- [x] Node version: 16.20
- [x] Browser: Chrome 118.0.5993.88

<!-- prettier-ignore-start -->
[blog]: https://circleci.com/blog/triggering-trusted-ci-jobs-on-untrusted-forks/
[script]: https://github.com/jklukas/git-push-fork-to-upstream-branch
<!-- prettier-ignore-end -->

issue.title: [Feature Request] OHIF should support US Region Calibration - Sequence Of Ultra Sound Regions (0018,6011)
issue.body:
### What feature or change would you like to see made?

Changes to make include...

- parsing each region
- when the length tool is applied, the region of each end point should be looked up and the appropriate measurement calculated and units displayed

### Why should we prioritize this feature?

By supporting this, measurements on ultrasounds will be calibrated properly and the correct units will be displayed.

comment.body: @sedghi to reach out during office hours/post to request ultrasound users for more data to help support use case

2. Possibility to print an active image
...

**Why should we prioritize this feature?**

...

- button to leave fullscreen
- press esc to exit fullscreen

We will revisit further enhancements after this prototype: floating toolbars, swap between full screen viewports, more than 1 viewport full screen

issue.title: CINE Player's FPS Slider should use the default FrameTime when provided

labels.name: Awaiting Reproduction
labels.description: Can we reproduce the reported bug?

issue.body:
Created By: https://github.com/OHIF/Viewers/issues/336

*Context:*

The community issue includes a good overview and context for this issue. Be sure to give it a read. We should be using the DICOM tag "FrameTime" as the initial FPS value for the CINE Player. This also means that, on init and activeSeries change, the component needs to make sure it's sync'd it's value with `cornerstone-tools` CINE player rate.

This value is most commonly set in Ultrasound images and Cardiac. Find a few good test images, or create a fake metadataProvider that has values set for these tags.

It's possible for each Frame to have it's own "FrameTime". For this chunk of work, we can use the first image in the series for now to set/find that value.

*Acceptance Criteria:*

- [ ] When opening the CINE Player for the first time, it's FPS should match the FrameTime tag's value
- [ ] When "playing" the series should use the default FrameTime tag's value
- [ ] Switching to a new series that has a FrameTime tag should update it's FPS Slider's value
- [ ] If the FPS has been changed from the default value, we should track and persist that change for each series it was changed on

*Bonus:*

While we're here, let's clean up the UX a bit.

- [ ] The CINE Player modal should appear directly beneath the CINE Player ToolbarButton when open
- [ ] The CINE Player should have a "reset" button to "reset" to the default FrameTime
- [ ] The CINE Player should indicate if/when the FrameTime value is set by the series (first image)

*Discussion:*

- Should we restore the ability to drag the CINE Player modal?
- Should we look for alternative UI to replace the "Modal" with something that provides a better UX?

comment.body: @jbocce to revisit and see what has already been checked off this report, and if we are missing anything what we can add

issue.title: [Bug] WADO call instead of QIDO

labels.name: Awaiting Reproduction
labels.description: Can we reproduce the reported bug?

issue.body:
### Describe the Bug

Hello👋 
I'm observing strange behavior on the new OHIF version. 
I'm using the viewer setup by overriding the default configuration. I set the default.js file with **wadoUriRoot** and **wadoRoot** to my wado endpoint, and **qidoRoot** to my qido endpoint.
However, when I load a series in the viewer, I'm facing a strange call:
https://hostname/my_wado_endpoint/studies/2.16.56.465769650.1.49565750525656/series?SeriesInstanceUID=1.3.12.2.1107.5.3.33.1103.2.201005141318130750

![image](https://github.com/OHIF/Viewers/assets/4542315/d4718681-bce1-4f59-9283-c27749d95169)

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Load a series via a direct URL to the viewer: https://hostname/.../ohif/viewer?StudyInstanceUIDs=2.16.56.465769650.3317998548.3382173681&SeriesInstanceUIDs=1.2.840.113619.2.278.3.655633.665.1340370393.118.3

### The current behavior

The call https://hostname/my_wado_endpoint/studies/2.16.56.465769650.1.49565750525656/series?SeriesInstanceUID=1.3.12.2.1107.5.3.33.1103.2.201005141318130750
is targeting WADO url

### The expected behavior

payload.description: OHIF zero-footprint DICOM viewer and oncology specific Lesion Tracker, plus shared extension packages

release.name: v3.8.0-beta.6
release.body:
# [3.8.0-beta.6](https://github.com/OHIF/Viewers/compare/v3.8.0-beta.5...v3.8.0-beta.6) (2023-10-25)


### Bug Fixes

* **toolbar:** allow customizable toolbar for active viewport and allow active tool to be deactivated via a click ([#3608](https://github.com/OHIF/Viewers/issues/3608)) ([dd6d976](https://github.com/OHIF/Viewers/commit/dd6d9768bbca1d3cc472e8c1e6d85822500b96ef))

Bug Fixes

issue.title: annotation always having frameindex=0

labels.name: Awaiting Reproduction
labels.description: Can we reproduce the reported bug?

issue.body:
i am printing the measurementData on console. On whichever frame i am drawing the annotation, the data is always having frameindex=0. 
Having the measurement data, i want to draw the annotation on its correct frame.
![Screenshot from 2020-06-29 00-43-54](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/43386041/85956172-ba9dd300-b9a1-11ea-86e4-be2158835e80.png)
here for example, the image belongs to 41st frame, but frameindex=0 in measurementData of annotation.

comment.body: @jbocce try to reproduce with multiframe data. @sedghi provide dataset to test if needed

issue.title: Measurements being stored as seperate study

labels.name: Awaiting Reproduction
labels.description: Can we reproduce the reported bug?

issue.body:
I'm using the latest version of OHIF (built from source) and Orthanc. The bug can be reproduced as follows:

1) open study from studylist
2) make a measurement
3) save the measurement
4) open Orthanc explorer which will show that the measurements are not saved in the study but as a separate study
5) Also study can no longer be opened in OHIF viewer until the study with measurements is deleted.

![Annotation 2020-05-04 021303](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5023419/80925865-d7a49400-8dac-11ea-9225-9675fc7fae03.png)

comment.body: @jbocce to reproduce in current version and close if no longer an issue

issue.title: Saving measurements to structured reports incorrectly updates study date

labels.name: Awaiting Reproduction
labels.description: Can we reproduce the reported bug?

issue.body:
> **Before Creating an issue**
>
> - Are you running the latest version? Yes
> - Are you reporting to the correct repository? Yes
> - Did you search existing issues? Yes

## Bug Report

### Describe the Bug

After creating a structured report, the displayed study dates have issues:
![Screen Shot 2021-11-22 at 6 29 32 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20689297/142963028-06b7405d-ff19-4f27-9664-49ce33486f1f.jpg)

- Location 1 has the creation date of the structured report (22-Nov-2021) - this is expected
- Location 2 also has the creation date of the structured report (22-Nov-2021) - this seems unexpected as it should have the original study date that is shown in location 3.  Location 2 used to display 27-Apr-1998 as well until we created the SR. We are wondering if this is the intended behavior.
- Location 3 has the original date (27-Apr-1998) - this is expected

The dates get more interesting as time passes. See an example where we created a structured report on 09-Nov-2021. 
![Screen Shot 2021-11-22 at 6 26 10 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20689297/142962851-80adba2c-e518-41ec-b71c-65a92e2001a4.jpg)

- Location 1 says the SR creation date (9-Nov-2021) - expected
- Location 2 and 3 both say the current date (22-Nov-2021) - seems incorrect



### What steps can we follow to reproduce the bug?

1. Open the viewer and make measurements using the measurements tool
2. Save the measurements to a structured report in the right measurements pane
3. Refresh the page
4. Within the studies pane on the left, the study date is at the top of the page. This is now updated to be the creation date (today) of the structured report. After some time, the date in the top left of the viewer will also reflect this date.
5. As days pass, the two dates that are shown will actually always update to the current date, even if the structured report create date was in the past. 


We are currently investigating ourselves. We are wondering if this is somehow the intended behavior though.

> :warning: Reports we cannot reproduce are at risk of being marked stale 
and
> closed. The more information you can provide, the more likely we are to look
> into and address your issue.

issue.title: Bottom border of the last row of viewports gets clipped in V3 at smaller widths

labels.name: Awaiting Reproduction
labels.description: Can we reproduce the reported bug?

issue.body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! bug_report_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://github.com/OHIF/Viewers/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md -->
<!-- 🕮 Read our guide about our process: https://v3-docs.ohif.org/development/our-process -->
<!-- 🔎 Search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- 🧪 Test using the latest version -->

### Describe the Bug

Resizing the browser window to a smaller width will cause the bottom border of the bottom row of viewports to get clipped. The suspected cause of the problem is wrapping that occurs in the top toolbar - wrapping of the "Investigational Use Only" banner.

### Steps to Reproduce:

1. Launch OHIF V3.
2. Resize the browser window to a smaller width where the "Investigational Use Only" begins to wrap and/or the bottom border of the bottom row of viewports gets clipped.

### The current behavior

See the attached video...

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/109477394/218106799-01edf117-3c91-42d4-a86c-2d26c04a44d0.mp4

### The expected behavior

The bottom border is not clipped.

> :warning: Reports we cannot reproduce are at risk of being marked stale and
> closed. The more information you can provide, the more likely we are to look
> into and address your issue.

comment.body: Revisit when we redo mobile design @dan-rukas

commits.message:
fix(toolbar): allow customizable toolbar for active viewport and allow active tool to be deactivated via a click (#3608)

Co-authored-by: Joe Boccanfuso <joe.boccanfuso@radicalimaging.com>

pull_request.title: fix(toolbar): allow customizable toolbar for active viewport and allow active tool to be deactivated via a click
pull_request.body:
### Context

Some tools like crosshairs appear to be more toggle based tools, but are also tool based in that they link a specific button.  This change allows a default tool to be set which will be activated to turn the tool off.  As well, some tools are not applicable
in all tool group ids, so this change allows the menu to be set per tool group.

### Changes & Results

Apply the defaultTool to turn off an active tool.

### Testing

1. Run the viewer in basic-test-mode.
2. Launch MPR.
3. Notice that the toolbar changes to add the crosshairs tool
4. Use the crosshairs tool.
5. Click the crosshairs tool to deactivate it.
6. The window level tool should now be active.

<!--
Describe how we can test your changes.
- open a URL
- visit a page
- click on a button
- etc.
-->

### Checklist

#### PR

<!--
https://semantic-release.gitbook.io/semantic-release/#how-does-it-work

Examples:
Please note the letter casing in the provided examples (upper or lower).

- feat(MeasurementService): add ...
- fix(Toolbar): fix ...
- docs(Readme): update ...
- style(Whitespace): fix ...
- refactor(ExtensionManager): ...
- test(HangingProtocol): Add test ...
- chore(git): update ...
- perf(VolumeLoader): ...

You don't need to have each commit within the Pull Request follow the rule,
but the PR title must comply with it, as it will be used as the commit message
after the commits are squashed.
-->

- [] My Pull Request title is descriptive, accurate and follows the
  semantic-release format and guidelines.

#### Code

- [] My code has been well-documented (function documentation, inline comments,
  etc.)

#### Public Documentation Updates

<!-- https://docs.ohif.org/ -->

- [] The documentation page has been updated as necessary for any public API
  additions or removals.

#### Tested Environment

- [] OS: <!--[e.g. Windows 10, macOS 10.15.4]-->
- [] Node version: <!--[e.g. 16.14.0]-->
- [] Browser:
  <!--[e.g. Chrome 83.0.4103.116, Firefox 77.0.1, Safari 13.1.1]-->
